oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The tomb of Andrew and Rachel Jackson in the Hermitage Garden
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This print shows the tomb of Andrew and Rachel Jackson in the gardens of The Hermitage, Jackson's home near Nashville, Tennessee. It is surrounded by trees and a fence.

Andrew Jackson died in 1845 while living at his home in Hermitage, Tennessee, after suffering from an extended period of declining health. He was 78. Two days after his death, he was buried in the Hermitage garden. Rachel Jackson was buried in 1828, in the white dress that she had purchased for her husband's inaugural ceremonies. She died from a heart attack, and had been under great stress in the weeks before her death. Jackson's political opponents had long cast doubts on his wife's honor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Jackson, Rachel, 1767-1828; United States presidents
